chinese: vt. 導致, 是…的原因；解釋 (= explain)；占…比例
example: Peter went to the bank to open an [account].
彼得去銀行開戶。
John refused to [account] for where he had been for several hours last night.
約翰拒絕解釋昨晚他去哪裡待了好幾個小時。
phrases: open an account 開戶
savings account 存款帳戶
take sth into account / take account of sth. 將某事物納入考量
by (from) all accounts 根據大家所說
on account of sb./sth. 因為…
account for sth. 導致某事物；解釋某事物；占某比例

example: The doctor told the pregnant mother not to smoke, as it might [affect] the baby.
醫生告訴那位懷孕的母親不要抽菸，因為這會影響到胎兒。

chinese: vt. 理解；欣賞 (= admire, honor, praise, respect, value)；感謝 (= thank)
example: We [appreciate] all the help you gave us last night.
我們很感激你昨晚提供的協助。
phrases: appreciate that + S + V 理解
fully appreciate 完全理解
be truly/properly appreciated 受到真正地/適切地重視
I/We would appreciate it if S + V-ed 如果…的話，我（們）會很感激的。

example: Diana was [born] into a rich family and lives a wealthy life.
黛安娜出生於富裕家庭，過著有錢人的生活。
phrases: be born into a(n) ... family 出生於…的家庭
be born to sb. 為某人所生的
be born with a silver spoon in one's mouth 含著金湯匙出生的
a born leader/salesperson/optimist 天生的領導人/業務/樂觀主義者
born and bred 土生土長的
I wasn't born yesterday. 我又不是三歲小孩。

chinese: n. [C] (社會、政治) 運動, 活動 (= movement)
vi. 從事運動；參加競選
example: Before the election, many candidates launched [campaigns] to promote themselves.
許多候選人在選舉前都發起活動來宣傳自己。
Many people have [campaigned] against drinking and driving.
許多人發起反對酒駕的運動。
phrases: campaign for/against sth. 從事支持/反對某事的運動
launch/conduct/carry on a campaign 發起運動
elections/sales campaign 選舉/促銷 活動
antinuclear/anti-smoking campaign 反核/禁菸 運動

example: Laura is an education [campaigner] who believes every child has the right to receive a good education.
蘿拉是教育運動的支持者，她相信每個孩童都應受到良好的教育。
phrases: campaigner for/against sth. 支持/反對 某事的運動參與者

example: There are many [choices] available to computer buyers at this large electronics shop.
這間大型電器用品店提供電腦買家多種選擇。
phrases: freedom of choice 選擇的自由
be given the choice 有選擇的權利
make a choice (between A and B) (在A和B之間) 做出選擇
one's first/second choice 某人的第一/第二志願
have no choice but to do sth. 不得不做某事

example: I enjoy listening to [classical] music, especially pieces composed by Beethoven.
我愛聽古典音樂，特別是貝多芬所作的曲子。
phrases: classical music 古典音樂

chinese: vt. vi. (使) 結合 (= connect, link, mix)
example: The cook [combined] Japanese food and Thai spices to create an interesting new dish.
那位廚師結合日本菜和泰式香料創造出一道新奇有趣的料理。
phrases: combine with sth. 和某物結合
combine A with/and B 將A與B結合

chinese: n. [C] [U] 結合, 組合 (= blend, mix, mixture)；密碼組
example: Please avoid taking this vitamin pill in [combination] with other medicines.
請避免將此維他命和其它藥物混合服用。
phrases: combination of A and B A與B的結合
in combination (with sb./sth.) (與…的) 結合
combination lock 密碼鎖

chinese: n. [C] 協議, 交易 (= contract)；大量
vt. 處理 (= handle)；買賣 (= trade)
example: Tom is an experienced businessman who knows how to strike [deals] with customers.
湯姆是名經驗的商人，他知道如何與顧客達成協議。
The president of a country [deals] with both foreign and domestic affairs.
一個國家的總統要同時處理外交及內政事務。
phrases: deal between A and B A與B之間的協議
cut/make/reach/strike a deal (with sb.) (與某人) 達成協議
get a good deal (on sth.) 用好價錢買到 (某物)
a good/great deal of sth. 大量的某物 (不可數)
What's the deal? 怎麼了？
It's a deal. 就這麼說定了。
It's no big/not that big (of) a deal. 這沒什麼。
deal with sb./sth. 處理…；應付…
deal in sth. 經營某物

chinese: adj. 廣闊的, 廣泛的 (= broad, vast)
example: American pop culture has an [extensive] influence on young people around the world.
美國流行文化對全世界的年輕人影響廣泛。
phrases: extensive reading 廣泛閱讀

chinese: n. [C] 農場, 田地 (= field)
example: There are some small [farms] outside the city that are used for growing vegetables.
離這座城市的外面有一些用來種植蔬菜的小農場。
Vivian's grandparents used to [farm] rice for a living.
薇薇安的祖父母曾靠種稻為生。
phrases: on a farm 在農場上

example: Ideas about marriage differ from one [generation] to another.
每個世代對於婚姻的觀念都有所不同。
phrases: the older/younger generation 較年長/較年輕的世代
the generation gap 代溝
from generation to generation 世世代代

example: The power went out, but we were able to use our backup [generator] for electricity.
雖然停電了，但我們可以改用備用發電機來發電。

chinese: adj. 灰色的；(頭髮) 灰白的
example: The children couldn't see the sun through the [gray] clouds.
孩子們看不到被烏雲遮擋住的太陽。

chinese: vt. 處理 (= manage, deal with, take care of)
example: Tracy is our best salesperson, so we let her [handle] our important clients.
崔西是我們最好的銷售員，所以我們讓她處理重要客戶。
Alice slowly turned the [handle] and opened the door.
愛麗絲慢慢地轉動門把來開門。
Amy [hurried] to answer the phone because she had been expecting a call.
艾咪趕緊接電話，因為她一直在等一通電話。
George left home in a [hurry] and forgot to bring his umbrella.
喬治因趕著出門而忘了帶傘。
phrases: hurry up 趕快
hurry sb. up/along 催促某人
hurry to do sth. 匆忙做某事
hurry sb. into doing sth. 催趕某人做某事
be in a hurry 急迫的
be in no hurry / not be in any hurry 不急的
There's no hurry. 不急。

example: The manager was asked to make the [introductions] before the meeting started.
在會議開始前，那位經理被要求做自我介紹。
phrases: make the introductions 互相做自我介紹

chinese: n. [C] 法官；裁判；評審 (= critic)
vt. vi. 判斷 (= determine)；裁判
example: The [judges] sampled the dishes to decide on the winner of the cooking contest.
評審們品嚐菜餚以決定烹飪大賽的冠軍。
People tend to [judge] others on first impressions, although it is unfair to do so.
人們往往憑第一印象來評判他人，雖然這並不公平。
phrases: be the judge (of sth.) 讓某人自行 (對某事做出) 判斷
judge A on B 針對B評判A
judge A by B 以B評判A
judge A from B 從B評判A
judge A (to be) B 把A判斷為B
Never/Don't judge a book by its cover. 不要以貌取人。

example: This actor did not appear on screen until the [latter] part of the movie.
這名演員直到電影後半部才出現。
Between staying home and going out, Lisa chose the [latter].
在待在家和出門之間，麗莎選擇了後者。
Although he plays a gentleman in the movie, the actor is rude in real [life].
那名演員在電影中扮演紳士，但他在現實生活中卻很粗魯。
phrases: in (all) one's life 有生以來
all one's life (某人) 終其一生
for life 終其一生
lead a happy/normal/interesting life 過著快樂的/正常的/有趣的生活
risk one's life / put one's life at risk 冒著生命危險
life-size 真實大小的
daily life 日常生活
life vest/jacket 救生衣

chinese: n. [C] 大師, 專家 (= expert)；雇主 (舊式用法) (= boss)
vt. 精通 (= be skilled in)
example: Bruce Lee was a kung fu [master] who was famous with Western audiences.
李小龍是西方觀眾所熟悉的武術大師。
To [master] English, you need to use the language every day.
你要精通英語就必須每天使用這個語言。
phrases: master of/at sth. 某方面的專家
master's degree 碩士學位

example: Watching sad [movies] always makes Jane upset.
看悲劇電影總是讓珍妮難過。
phrases: go to the movies 看電影
horror/romantic/sci-fi/animated/B movie 恐怖/浪漫/科幻/動畫/低成本 電影
silent movie 默劇

chinese: vt. 必須, 需要 (= demand, require)
n. [S] [U] 需要 (= demand, necessity, requirement)
example: Kevin [needs] coffee in the morning to keep him awake.
凱文早上需要咖啡來保持清醒。
There is no [need] to buy a car, as public transportation is very convenient.
大眾運輸系統非常方便，因此沒有必要買車。
phrases: need A for B 因B而需要A
need to do sth. 必須做某事
need sb. to do sth. 需要某人做某事
need for sth./sth. 對於…的需求
there is a/no need (for sb.) to do sth. (某人) 有/沒有做某事的需要
meet/fulfill a need 滿足需求
those in need 貧苦人家
in need of sth. 需要某事物

chinese: n. [C] 乘客, 旅客 (= traveler)
example: [Passengers] must have their boarding passes ready before getting on the airplane.
旅客必須在登機前把登機證準備好。
phrases: transfer passenger 轉乘旅客

example: The editor went over the book before it was [printed].
那位編輯在書送印之前仔細地檢查一遍。
phrases: print (A) on B (把A) 印刷在B上
print in color/black and white 印成彩色/黑白
print sth. out/off 把某物印出來

chinese: vt. vi. 保護, 防護 (= cover, defend)
example: Seat belts were made to [protect] us from injury in the event of a car accident.
安全帶是用來保護我們發生車禍時不致受傷。
phrases: protect A from/against B 保護A不受到B的危害

example: Mark is organizing a beach cleanup as part of his studies on environmental [protection].
馬克正在籌備淨灘活動，這是他環保研究中的一部分。
phrases: copy protection 防盜拷
file protection 檔案保護
protection money 保護費

example: The teacher [punished] the naughty boy for not bringing his textbooks by giving him more homework.
這個調皮的男孩沒有把作業帶來，所以老師給他更多作業做為懲罰。
phrases: punish sb. for (doing) sth. 因某事懲罰某人
punish sb. with sth. 讓某人接受某懲罰

chinese: n. [C] [U] 等級；位階 (= position, status)
n. [C] [U] (尤指排排站立的) 行, 列, 排
vt. vi. (使) 具有…地位, (將…) 列為…等級
example: Jack has just been promoted to the [rank] of sales manager.
傑克剛被升為業務經理。
The movie we saw yesterday [ranks] as one of the best movies ever made.
我們昨天看的那個電影可算是史上最好的電影之一。
phrases: senior/junior rank 高/低 階 (職位)
rank high/low 排高/排低, 位居
rank as sth. 可看作…
rank among sth. 予其是…中的一員

chinese: vi. 顫抖, 發抖 (= shake, tremble)
example: At the crime scene, the little girl [shivered] with fear.
那個女孩在犯罪現場害怕地發抖。
A [shiver] ran through Mary's body when she saw the snake.
當瑪麗看到蛇的時候全身發抖。
phrases: shiver with cold/fear/surprise 冷地/害怕地/驚訝地 顫抖
shiver of horror/shock/excitement 因 害怕/震驚/興奮 而產生的顫抖
give sb. the shivers 讓某人嚇得發抖

example: Jerry looked at me [skeptically], even though I was telling the truth.
傑瑞用懷疑的眼神看著我，儘管我說的是實話。

chinese: adj. 可疑的；懷疑的 (= doubtful, skeptical)
example: Mandy saw a [suspicious] stranger hanging around her house last night.
曼蒂昨晚看到一名可疑的陌生人在她家附近走動。
phrases: be suspicious about/of sb./sth. 對…抱持懷疑
suspicious glance/look 懷疑的一瞥/眼神

chinese: adv. 可疑地；懷疑地 (= doubtfully, skeptically)
example: She looked at me [suspiciously], as if she knew I was lying.
她懷疑地看著我，彷彿知道我在說謊一樣。
This [tiny] puppy is still too young to walk properly.
這隻小狗仍太年幼以致於無法走穩。
phrases: tiny little 極微小的
a tiny bit ... 稍微…；一點點…

chinese: n. [C] 旅行, 行程 (= tour)
vt. vi. (使) 絆倒 (= fall, tumble)
example: The travel agency provides a wide variety of [trips] for customers.
這間旅行社為顧客提供各種不同的行程。
Tim [tripped] over a toy and fell down this morning.
提姆今早被玩具絆倒了。
phrases: go on/take a trip (to swh.) (到某處) 旅遊
bus/train/boat trip 搭公車/火車/船之旅
business/fishing/shopping trip 出差/釣魚/購物行
trip (sb.) up 絆倒 (某人)
trip on/over sth. 被某物絆倒

example: Joyce speaks French quite [well] because she has lived in France for ten years.
喬伊絲法文講得非常好，因為她在法國居住了十年。
Allen didn't feel [well], so he left school early to see a doctor.
亞倫覺得不舒服，所以提早放學去看醫生。
phrases: very/rather/fairly/pretty/quite well 非常好地
well ahead/behind 很 前面/後面
well done 做得很好
as well 也
A as well as B A 以及 B
be doing well 身體狀況好轉
may/might (just) as well do sth. 不妨做某事
may/might well do sth. 大有可能做某事；理所當然可以做某事
feel well 感到健康
all is well 一切安好
get well soon 早日康復
